PageTitle: ipv6 nd na send multicast rate-limit (interface view)
FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd na send multicast rate-limit command configures a rate limit for sending ND NA multicast messages on an interface, that is, the maximum number of ND NA multicast messages that can be sent per second.
The undo ipv6 nd na send multicast rate-limit command restores the default configuration. The ipv6 nd na send multicast rate-limit command configures a rate limit for sending ND NA multicast messages on an interface, that is, the maximum number of ND NA multicast messages that can be sent per second. The undo ipv6 nd na send multicast rate-limit command restores the default configuration. By default, the rate limit for sending ND NA multicast messages is not configured on an interface, and ND NA messages are sent at a rate limit configured on an interface. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: ipv6 nd na send multicast rate-limit <rate-limit>
undo ipv6 nd na send multicast rate-limit <rate-limit>
ParentView: 100ge sub-interface view,10GE sub-interface view,10GE interface view,200GE sub-interface view,200GE interface view,25GE sub-interface view,25GE interface view,400GE sub-interface view,400GE interface view,50GE sub-interface view,50GE interface view,Eth-Trunk sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk interface view,VBDIF interface view,VLANIF interface view,Management interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a rate limit for sending ND NA multicast messages on an interface.
The value is an integer, in messages/second. The value ranges from 1 to 10240.

Specifies a rate limit for sending NA multicast messages on an interface.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-Eth-Trunk1] ipv6 nd na send multicast rate-limit 550
